content.description: Sit start with a low left-hand meathook and a large right foothold. Pull onto the wall and make a big move up to a sloper before matching and figuring out how to mantle the beast.
content.location: This short problem climbs the left side of the neat uphill overhanging face.

content.description:
This is an incredibly steep line that climbs out of a cave on an astonishing sloping rail feature.

 Sit-start underneath the boulder matched on the sloping rail. Situate the feet before moving out left to a sloping gaston before encountering an improbable lip sequence on some extremely sloping holds. This section of the climb is then followed by an insecure and very balance oriented press onto a slab. The last execution of a hard barndoor move procures a large undercling feature. From here a few steps out left gains the climber some positive holds in a crack and an easy way to the top of the large boulder.
content.protection: 1 or 2 standard-sized pads and a briefcase pad.
content.location: When staring at the overhang that resembles "Leave It to Beaver" walk left and hop down a rock and the steep line coming out of the cave will become visible.

content.description: Stand start the slab and venture up to some positive uncut holds and then jugs at the top.
content.protection: 1 pad. The landing was once a gaping pit but has been filled in with logs and branches. It may still be hazardous so tread carefully.
content.location: This one is found to the left of "From Good to Gourmet". When at the top of the area facing "Eager Beaver" this climb is to the left around the corner.

content.description: Start under the overhang on a giant right handhold. Pull-on with some poor feet and make a big move up to the next large feature. From here piece it together and figure out how to grab the sloping lip in order to topout.
content.location: Sit-start under the right arete. There is a large rock that forms a bit of a cubicle.

content.description: This large boulder sits on the hillside in a clearing which provides a great place to warm up and hang out. This boulder has 3 established lines on it thus far and also has some easy slab climbs.   The steep overhanging uphill side of the boulder resembles the large boulder in Pawtuckaway State Park that is home to the classic "Leave It to Beaver", this resemblance earned this block its name.
